goal: Add a visible cave entrance on the eastern winter forest edge, with basic enter behavior and fog-of-war-compatible mapping for the cave mouth.
decisions: Represent the cave mouth as a GenericStructure object anchored on a winter forest tile near the eastern edge of the map, instead of introducing a full cave biome yet.
Keep cave logic lightweight for now: entering only moves the player onto the entrance tile and narrates a dark interior, reserving deeper cave mapping for a later task.
Use the existing visited set and map JSON to ensure the cave entrance participates in fog-of-war, and highlight it both in local descriptions and on the web map glyphs.
Bootstrap the cave entrance via bootstrap_structures so existing saves automatically gain the new object without breaking compatibility.
plan: Choose a fixed winter forest coordinate on the eastern side of the world and define it as the cave entrance anchor.
Add a cave entrance object at that coordinate during game state bootstrap, ensuring it appears in object-based descriptions and visibility checks.
Extend the enter command so that enter cave (or similar text) moves the player onto the entrance tile and describes the dark interior while blocking deeper progress.
Tag the cave entrance tile in the web map state JSON and render a distinct glyph so the entrance is easy to spot once discovered.
Run build/tests and then update todo.json with status and a short progress note once everything compiles and basic interactions behave as expected.
notes: The cave currently has no separate interior room system; deeper exploration is narrative-only and will require a later task to add an actual cave map or room graph.
Save compatibility is important: if older saves lack the cave object, bootstrap_structures should quietly add it on load without touching other structures or items.
